page.title: 04Cliff Farm-Shanklin
page.content: {Cliff Farm is near Shanklin.}They take 4 beef cattle to the slaughter house a week. Mr.Mew buys about 8 beef cattle and fattens them up to take to a show to try and win prizes. For a few months Mr.Mew keeps turkeys to sell for Christmas. Mr.Mew says the worst part are foxes, rooks and dogs. They have got about 300 baby lambs and many sheep. They don't have scarecrows but they hang dead rooks to show others that they might get killed. They have 1 horse. Also in their garden they grow fruit. The land is very hilly that's why they have sheep. The sheep have to be dipped once at the end of June and September, they stay in the dip for a minute and their head is pushed under three times. The farm is skirted by many footpaths,including the{Worsley {Trail. }
